intro: Phenax microcarpus, commonly known as the small-fruited phenax, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its slender, clustered growth habit. The plant produces small, elongated fruits that are typically clustered at the base of the leaves. Its leaves are long and pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Phenax microcarpus is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
